                   (3) A pension payable pursuant to subsection (1) shall
             be payable-
                 (a) in the case of a person who was a widow of a
                      National Hero on the 1st day of April, 1972, with
                      effect from that date;
                 (b) in the case of a widow of a person upon whom the
                      honour of National Hero is conferred posthumous-
                      ly after the 1st day of April, 1972, with effect from
                      the date on which the honour is so conferred;
                 (c) in any other case, with effect from the day
                      immediately following the date of the National
                      Hero's death.
                     (4) Where pension is payable under subsection (I) to a
             widow who, apart from the provision of this section, is en-
             titled to pension in respect of her deceased husband's public
             service, she shall be paid at her election either the pension
             under subsection (1)or the pension in respect of her deceased
             husband's public service but not both.
                    (5) An election under subsection (4) shall be in Writing
             addressed to the Minister responsible for finance and shall
             be irrevocable.
                   (6) Nothing in subsection (4) shall prevent payment to
             a widow of any pension to which she is entitled in respect
             of her own public service.
